;

;Alice band, from left: Takao Horiuchi, Shinji Tanimura, Toru Yazawa;(Information picture/picture);

;

;;"Pleiades" and China;

;

;In childhood, born in Osaka As soon as Tanimura Shinji closes his eyes, he will see a scenery: endless grassland, mountains in the distance, stars all over the sky, cool breeze, swaying grass and trees. "I have a feeling that I have been there. That scenery is my hometown in a previous life. This feeling is very strong and real." Tanimura said.

;

;In 1980, this feeling became the creative inspiration of Shinji Tanimura. He wrote his most famous masterpiece "Subaru" (also called "Subaru") in the future. In China, fans are accustomed to (called "Star"): I closed my eyes, my heart was at a loss, I looked up sadly, my eyes were full of desolation, there was only one road leading to the wilderness... I will travel far, see you again, the Pleiades hang high! ——The Pleiades star cluster is located in the constellation Taurus and consists of more than 3,000 stars. It is extremely bright in the night sky and is especially dazzling in autumn and winter. The brighter ones form the Pleiades.

;

;In May 1980, this song was included in the album of the same name. On the album cover, a line of light and shadow cuts across the darkness. Half of Tanimura's body is buried in the darkness, and half of his body stretches out from the light. He nods slightly, eyes fixed forward, and is ready to go. This song has a melancholy tone, bleak lyrics, and sad images, but its perspective is bright. After the song came out, it became very popular in Japan and sold more than 600,000 copies. In 1987, Shinji Tanimura participated in Japan's annual "Red and White Song Festival" for the first time, singing "Subaru", and the TV ratings exceeded 63%. Since then, he has participated in the "Red and White Song Gala" for many years and has become a veteran singer in this most representative show at the end of the year in Japan.

;

;In September 1980, the ATV TV series "The Love of the Earth" was launched. In early 1981, singer Guan Zhengjie included the Cantonese version of "Star" in his TV original soundtrack album "The Love of the Earth", with lyrics written by Zheng Guojiang . In 1982, Teresa Teng sang the Japanese and Cantonese versions of "Star" at the Elizabeth Stadium concert in Hong Kong. As a result, this song became popular in southern China and radiated to the north. Singer Shen Xiaocen included the Japanese version of "Star" in his second album. Since then, this song has been covered by singers such as Alan Tam, Xu Xiaofeng, Feng Feifei, Han Baoyi, and Cheng Lin.

;

;A friend told Shinji Tanimura that the picture in his mind seemed to depict Northeast China, so going to China became his dream. "I have always wanted to visit China, but I don't know why. But I know that as long as I go, I will understand why I want to go to China."

;

;;

;

;2004 On November 5, 2019, Shinji Tanimura participated in the "Jewel Heart" Shanghai Concert;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;In 1981, Tanimura Shinji participated in the "Hand in Hand Beijing" concert held at Beijing Workers' Stadium with Chinese singers. He recalled that as soon as he landed at the Chinese airport, he felt like going home. "Even the earthy smell that hit my face felt very familiar. ."

;

;The concert lasted for two days. At this time, pop music was in its infancy in China. The tens of thousands of spectators in the work hall sat in silence, with no applause or cheers. They were used to the warm live atmosphere in Japan. Tani Cun was very uncomfortable with it. He and the members of his rock band Alice tried every means to mobilize the audience. After they sang a rhythmic song, people in the venue stood up and applauded continuously. Shinji Tanimura was very excited: "Everyone feels the same about music, and music has no national boundaries."

;

;He sang "Subaru" live. This was the beginning of his singing reaching the ears of Chinese audiences. So far, nearly 50 of his works have been adapted into Chinese songs, including Leslie Cheung's "Who Resonates" (adapted from "Like a Dream"), Anita Mui's "Walking Alone" (adapted from "This is my trial") "), Jacky Cheung's "The Distant Her" (adapted from "Romantic Railway"), Priscilla Chan's "Forgetting Sorrow" (adapted from "Autumn Stoppers")...

;

;;

;

;2007 On September 20, in Nantong, Jiangsu, at the opening ceremony of the 9th China Asian Arts Festival and the Gala "Under the Same Starry Sky", Shinji Tanimura sang "Flower" ; (Visual China/Photo) ;

;

;In 2001, Shinji Tanimura, who was already successful, came to the Yellow River specifically to try to find similar feelings from his childhood, but found nothing. From this, he became more certain that the scene should be near Heilongjiang in Northeast China. Tanimura said with a smile: "Maybe I was Chinese in my previous life."

;

;In 2003, China suffered from the SARS epidemic. In order to help China fight against SARS, Shinji Tanimura held a "Concert to Support China in Fighting SARS" in Osaka and donated all the 15.34 million yen (approximately US$120,000) raised to the Red Cross Society of China. After SARS ended, he flew to China and held a concert to thank medical workers.

;

;At the 2010 Shanghai World Expo, Teng Junjie, the chief director of the opening and closing ceremonies, invited Tanimura to perform on stage at the opening ceremony, and Tanimura agreed. For this reason, he canceled several performances in Japan and made compensation. On the evening of April 30, 2010, at the Shanghai World Expo Cultural Center, Asian girls walked out from both sides holding stars in their hands. They complemented the lights of the audience and seemed to stretch out into a galaxy. Shinji Tanimura, China's overseas promotion ambassador for the 2010 Shanghai World Expo, brought the audience to the audience. The familiar classic song "Subaru".

;

;Teng Junjie and Tani Cun have been friends for nearly 20 years. He recalled in an interview: "When Abe and Koizumi were in office, (Japan) had trouble getting along with China, he went directly to Koizumi and told him that his attitude towards China must change. Japan must stand with China, and we two Asian countries must Take this responsibility."

;

;Tanimura is very willing to spend time face-to-face with young Chinese people. In March 2004, the Shanghai Conservatory of Music hired Shinji Tanimura as permanent professor of the Department of Music Engineering and consultant of the Sino-Japanese Music Culture Research Center. This job lasted until 2008. While serving as a visiting professor at the Shanghai Conservatory of Music, Shinji Tanimura spent one week every month in Shanghai.

;

;The theme of Tanimura's class is "How to express music." Start with the lyrics first. A reporter visited his class. Tanimura entered the classroom, first put half a glass of water on the table, pushed the glass over, and the water came out. He asked the students to write lyrics about it. He left the classroom for 20 minutes and came back to check. The lyrics of a classmate impressed him deeply: When water flows outside, water never knows what its own shape is... "The most important thing is the inner feeling. Only there are people, and I am. If people want to be connected, music is The best medium. Music can best enter people's hearts, resonate and move, and hearts can meet." Shinji Tanimura told the reporter.

;

;The inspiration and core of the song "Subaru" became one of the important narratives of Shinji Tanimura's future life. As written in the song, he has always felt that "starlight leads the way." When the 32-year-old Tanimura composed this song, he had no idea of ​​its vast magic, which could transcend time and travel through space, and continue to echo throughout his artistic career.

;

;"At that time, Japan's economy was developing rapidly, giving people the illusion that as long as they had money, they could buy everything. But this song tells people: truly precious things need to be felt with the heart. Care, tenderness , consideration, love, etc., these invisible things are crucial to us." Tanimura said.

;

;For more than 40 years, he has performed and visited various Asian countries and often heard local people singing this song, regardless of gender, young or old. The other person even thought it was the song of his own country. He was once asked: "Do you know this song?"

;

;""Subaru" is the key to opening the door to all Asia and can connect everyone together. ." Tanimura said, "There is no doubt that "Subaru" changed my life. This song took me on a magnificent journey."

;

;;

;

;Shinji Tanimura and Teresa Teng Singing on the same stage ; (video screenshot/picture);

;

;;Showa "Legendary";

;

; On September 21, 2018, Shinji Tanimura, who was almost 70 years old, held the "38th Year of Stars" concert at the Shanghai Grand Theater. At the age of 25, Tanimura's hairline began to recede, and he began to grow a beard to achieve visual balance on his face. Nearly 45 years have passed, and his works have stayed at a certain point like his hairline, becoming synonymous with his achievements. And his voice is inevitably aging like his hair color. His beard and hair are all white. Even if he sings "Pleiades" with exactly the same arrangement, you can hear the decline in function, but there are gains and losses. At this time, It has the mellowness and sweetness given by age.

;

;Tanimura Shinji grew up and became famous during the Showa period, and he has obvious Showa characteristics. Shinji Tanimura appears in public and has a decent image. He always had a smile on his face, and his eight teeth were gleaming white. He is diligent, confident, vigorous and friendly, and uses subtle strokes to outline the complexity of the grand narrative. Since his debut, he has held 3,620 concerts in Japan and is still the number one in Japan. He has released 63 albums and 62 singles, with a total sales volume of more than 30 million. He is called the godfather of the Japanese music industry. In the media description, he always promotes Sino-Japanese friendship from the bottom of his heart, cultivates young people with full expectations, and pours his blood into music.

;

;Perhaps partly due to the language barrier, Chinese reporters said his voice was soft and slow. If you don’t prick up your ears to distinguish it carefully, it may even be masked by the sound of the indoor air conditioner. "People are as quiet as songs." But if you listen to his works and understand his experience, both the premise and the conclusion of this sentence will be invalid.

;

;In 1948, Shinji Tanimura was born in Osaka. When he was a child, he was overweight and was nicknamed "Fat Pig" by his classmates. His self-esteem was greatly affected. When he was in elementary school, he heard singer Xiao Linxu singing "Migratory Bird" in a performance. He was attracted by Xiao Linxu's gesture of strumming the guitar and started learning guitar, deciding to regain his confidence.

;

;In 1965, he formed the band Rock Candie with his classmates. Their style was more country folk and their rebellious playing style made the audience feel novel. In 1970, this band held an "American Continent Tour". They first arrived in Vancouver. Because they were too poor, they had to take a bus across the North American continent all the way to New York. After ten days of tossing, they finally reached their destination. In New York, Shinji Tanimura watched a local rock performance. He shed tears at Janis Joplin's performance, "It turns out that music still has such a possibility."

;

;After returning to China, He formed a new band, Alice, but the band's American blues style was not accepted by the Japanese audience. Alice had to perform in various places to meet daily expenses and continue her acting career. During her frequent performances, Alice set a record of holding 303 concerts a year. As the band's popularity expanded in various places, their songs such as "Winter Thunder and Lightning" and "The Pledge of Tears" also gradually became popular. In 1978, they became the first group of Japanese artists to successfully hold a three-day concert at Nippon Budokan.

;In November 1974, Shinji Tanimura's first solo album "蜜" was released. He wrote the lyrics and music for the entire album. One year later, in December, Tanimura Shinji released his second solo album "Umimako". In this quiet work, there are many shining works, such as "Port Lights", "Sunflower", "Warmth", "Sunset", "The Road of Sand"... After entering the 1980s, Tanimura produced more and more excellent works. In the 1990s, the theme song "Fengzihuaden" of Toei animation "Three Kingdoms" was released, and "Hometown", a collaboration with singer and actor Yuzo Kayama... are all Widespread.

;

;Tanimura’s life is very interesting. After a concert, he once walked into a small bookstore and offered himself to collect money for the store manager while he was having dinner. Fans who come to the bookstore after listening to Tanimura's concert will receive an oncoming surprise when paying. In Japanese variety shows in the 1990s, he was experienced, relaxed, unencumbered, and spoke humorously. One second he was not ashamed to share his embarrassing story with the host: due to a bad gastrointestinal condition, the stool collapsed in his pants when he farted; the next second he picked up the guitar and taught them his valuable experience in the music industry for many years: the most important thing is the song Express your heart, not whether it can be passed down to the world or how many people will sing it.

;

;In his later years, Tanimura conducted a deeper exploration of musical expression. The subtleties of his singing have been accurate to every modal word. In the song "Woo Hu", he poured different techniques into each "ah" to achieve the emotions he expected, such as the feelings in his heart that he wanted to suppress but couldn't. Sigh while staying.

;

;In 2017, Tanimura held a concert "Commemorating the 45th Anniversary of the Normalization of Diplomatic Relations between China and Japan - 2017 Shinji Tanimura's 45th Anniversary of His Performing Career in Shanghai" at the Shanghai Grand Theater. At the scene, a beam of chasing light hit the side of the stage and enveloped an empty chair. The prelude of "Restaurant Corner" sounded, and on the other side of the stage, Tanimura picked up the microphone and said: "Next, I will sing a set of narrative love songs for everyone..." "Narrative Love Songs" is his new attempt ——"Explain" the ins and outs of creating the song at the beginning of each song by chatting and heart-to-heart with the audience. In a set of five "narrative love songs", Tanimura uses the woman's mood and the man's perspective to connect the ups and downs of love emotions, just like a love short film.

;

;To commemorate the "two 45th anniversaries", Tanimura released a set of three albums called "Standard", each with 15 songs, for a total of 45 songs. The first album is representative works selected from the songs he composed; the second album is taken from Alice's period works; and the third album is Japanese classic songs sung by him. His criteria for selecting tracks to enter this album are: "Children 100 years from now will think that these works are indeed classics."

;

;These tracks are also arranged in the order of the ups and downs of life and the ups and downs of emotions. The first part is full of ambition, and in the end there will be a starry reverie like "Pleiades": "A person's daily life must be ups and downs, but he will not stick to these emotions and feelings every day. Life and music have something in common . I want to reflect the ups and downs of life into music... Even if the melody on the stage is occasionally sad and disappointing, it must be exciting and upward in the end!"

;

;September 28, 2018, The "38th Year of Stars" concert in Beijing became Shinji Tanimura's last public performance in China. On October 8, 2023, Shinji Tanimura died of illness at the age of 74. The funeral was held on October 15, with only close relatives in attendance. On October 16, the news of his death was made public.
